column3: Automatic sanity-testing: PASSED, see http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/887ca8c9a7a1e1da5ca2704815d4425801b00a22 for binaries and test log.\nThis test script verifies pulls every time they are updated. It, however, dies sometimes and fails to test properly.  If you are waiting on a test, please check timestamps to verify that the test.log is moving at http://jenkins.bluematt.me/pull-tester/cu
This will not show up for Bitcoin-Qt as your code is in between `#if !defined(QT_GUI)`. For Qt you would need such a thing in bitcoin.cpp via a to be defined `GUIUtil::VersionMessageBox`.\n

It is compiled into Bitcoin-Qt as well. It is in the same place as the `--help` option in the code.

The output below is from Bitcoin-Qt on OSX. You can see from the output the `--help` option exists there. This change will do the same thing, except show only the version.

```
~ % /Applications/Bitcoin-Qt.app/Contents/MacOS/Bitcoin-Qt --help
Bitcoin-Qt version v0.8.1-beta

Usage:
  bitcoi
-v should be some kind of verbose flag usually... -V seems better for --version\n
Agree also with @luke-jr . "-v" should be reserved for "--verbose".\n
@laanwj I still think this won't work for Bitcoin-Qt, see my comments above about `--help`.\n

I had to get my development environment setup to compile Bitcoin-Qt. I have now verified this won't work for Bitcoin-Qt.

Thanks Philip. I am closing this pull request.
@nmarley no need to close the issue, you can re-push to the same branch after you've fixed it and it will show up here\n
